Nominee for Secretary

Secretary 1

Luis Campos

Luis Campos's Website

Current Position

Associate Professor and Regents' Lecturer, History Department, University of New Mexico

HSS and Related Activities

  • HSS Secretary, 2017-present
  • HSS Nominating Committee, 2014-2015
  • HSS Forum for the History of Science in America (FHSA), steering committee, 2012-2014
  • Member of the Editorial Board, Journal of the History of Biology
  • I have attended every HSS meeting since 2000 apart from one.

Publications

  1. Campos, Luis. Radium and the Secret of Life. University of Chicago Press, 2015.
  2. Campos, Luis. “Life as It Could Be.” In Social and Conceptual Issues in Astrobiology, edited by Kelly Smith and Carlos Mariscal, 101-114. Oxford University Press, 2020.
  3. Campos, Luis. “Other Genetic Alphabets.” Journal of Design and Science (December 2018).
  4. Campos, Luis. “Neanderthals in Space: George Church’s Modest Steps Toward Possible Futures.” In Dreamers, Visionaries and Revolutionaries in the Life Sciences, edited by Oren Harman and Michael Dietrich, 143-160. University of Chicago Press, 2018.
  5. Campos, Luis. “Dialectics Denied: Muller, Lysenkoism, and the Fate of Chromosomal Mutation.” In The Lysenko Controversy as a Global Phenomenon: Genetics and Agriculture in the Soviet Union and Beyond, edited by William de Jong-Lambert, and Nikolai Krementsov. Palgrave-Macmillan, 2017.
  6. Campos, Luis. “Outsiders and In-Laws: Drew Endy and the Case of Synthetic Biology.” In Outsider Scientists: Routes to Innovation in Biology, edited by Oren Harman and Michael Dietrich, 331-348. University of Chicago Press, 2013.
  7. Campos, Luis. “The BioBrick™ Road.” Biosocieties 7, no. 2 (June 2012): 115-139.
  8. Campos, Luis. Making Mutations: Objects, Practices, Contexts. Berlin: Max Planck Institute for the History of Science, 2010.
  9. Campos, Luis. “The Birth of Living Radium.” Representations 97 (2006): 1-29.

Nominee for Treasurer

Treasurer 1

Gwen Kay

Current Position

Professor, Department of History, State University of New York Oswego

Related Position(s)

President, SUNY University Faculty Senate

HSS and Related Activities

  • HSS Treasurer, 2017-present
  • HSS Finance Committee, 2016-present
  • HSS Membership Committee (ex officio), 2018-present
  • HSS Forum for the History of Science in America, treasurer, 2011-15
  • HSS Rossiter Prize Committee, 2012-14
  • HSS Forum for the History of Science in America steering committee, 2005, 2008-10
  • AAHM Education and Outreach Committee, 2008-10
  • HSS Women's Caucus co-chair, 2006-2008

Publications

  1. Kay, Gwen. “Home Economics Students, Past, Present, and Future.” In Service as Mandate: Land-Grant Universities and the Making of the Modern World, edited by Alan Marcus. University of Alabama, 2015.
  2. Kay, Gwen. “Changing Names, Keeping Identity.” In Remaking Home Economics, edited by Sharon Y. Nickols and Gwen Kay. University of Georgia Press, 2015.
  3. Kay, Gwen. “‘If It Did Not Exist, It Would Have to Be Invented:’ Home Economics in Transition at Iowa’s Regents Institutions.” In Annals of Iowa, , 132-160. 2011.
  4. Kay, Gwen. Dying to Be Beautiful: The Fight for Safe Cosmetics. Ohio State University Press, 2005.
